website_summaries.verdict: Highly rated USB cordless rechargeable dog nail grinder that's quiet and feels good in the hand. Good for small and medium dogs.
pros: Rechargeable via USB, this dog nail grinder features a diamond bit
Two speed settings allow greater grooming control
More powerful and quieter than most cordless models
cons: Grinding down nails is time-consuming unless you trim them first

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t normally write reviews, but I felt this one warranted one! I have a 6 year old mini dachshund and trimming nails has always been rough!! Screaming and biting (from the dog). I’ve tried other nail grinders and she was terrified of them. I came across this one and thought I’d give it a try. It took only 5 minutes to do ALL FOUR paws! She held perfectly still and didn’t fight me a single bit!! She even wagged her tail when we were done!! Hallelujah I think we found the tool for us!!!
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Ward

customer_reviews.title: Came fully charged and ready to go!  LOW NOISE!  Practical helpful hints for success.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second nail grinder I purchased for use with my 7 pound maltipoo. The first one we purchased was too loud and after several tries, I gave up on it. THIS ONE, however, is much quieter PLUS it gave helpful hints to get pets accustomed to having their nails done. I tried it as suggested; with a handful of treats on the counter right next to the grinder, which was turned on. After a few minutes of feeding her treats next to the grinder, I simply picked up her paw and began using it on her nails. She turned her head away a bit, but kept on eating her treats while I was filing her nails! HORRAY!!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Not Safe for Use on Pet
customer_reviews.text: My dog's nail got caught between the medal cover and the grinder and had to be rushed to the vet. The vet had to cut it the metal cover off the unit to separate the item from my dog's paw. Contacted Casfuy Direct about the issue and about paying the vet cost; received a reply, not in the states sorry. Do not recommended anyone purchase this item.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis K Steed Sr

customer_reviews.title: Dag nab it! Ripped off again!
customer_reviews.text: I hate this! When will I learn to not buy stupid stuff like this. My dogs hate to have their nails trimmed and this is not powerful enough to do it quickly. A manual regular nail trimmer works so much better . I really wished it worked. Maybe on little dogs with tiny toenails, but not for my Labradors nails. It will now go to the pile of crap that eventually gets sent to the thrift shop.
customer_reviews.author: Susan V

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous device
customer_reviews.text: I do not recommend purchasing this item for small dogs. I was trimming my dogs nail and it got stuck in the trimmer! After 30 minutes of her screaming and us trying to calm her to remove the nail from the trimmer, we were able to successfully get it off. This is such a dangerous device and caused so much pain to my dog. From now on I will be taking her to a groomer for professional nail trimming. This device isn’t it! If you have a larger dog with larger nails, it might work fine but this is definitely not designed for small dogs
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t recharge properly.
customer_reviews.text: I can not recommend this product because, when recharged, it wouldn’t hold the charge for more than 5 min before slowing down and stopping altogether after 10 min. I’m sad, actually, because my puppy learned to tolerate it very well and very quickly. Because of the low noise level and minimal vibration it was quite pleasant to use. I hope they are able to improve the charging mechanism.
customer_reviews.author: Janice

customer_reviews.title: Won’t recharge
customer_reviews.text: Worked great at first but then died and won’t recharge. Very disappointed because it only lasted 2 uses.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Slow going but less scary for dog and owner
customer_reviews.text: Takes a while to grind down the nails and I noticed some nail splitting the next day on the nails I filed. My dog gets nervous with grinding down the front nails because of the noise of the file. He doesn't seem to mind the grinding as much when I'm doing his back paws. I hate cutting my pets' nails so this is a great way to trim nails without cutting. This is less traumatic for me and my dog and even though it takes longer to cut the nails it's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: cawesome

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't file well at all.
customer_reviews.text: Five stars for everything BUT working well. Barely did anything for our dogs, and they're small. Boston terrier and a Dachshund. We returned it.
customer_reviews.author: RandomWittyName

customer_reviews.title: too weak
customer_reviews.text: The motor is too weak to grind. Barely work on my large dogs. Poor charger contact, it is hard to charge, running out of battery during use though full charged.
customer_reviews.author: bob

customer_reviews.title: Completely surprised
customer_reviews.text: Right when I open it I see blood in the box!! How disgusting is that? I’m a little scared to use this product. I don’t know it’s it human or dog blood. Either way there’s blood in the box 🤢🤮🤮🤮
customer_reviews.author: vanesa

customer_reviews.title: So slow!
customer_reviews.text: I was offered $10 in Amazon gift card from the trimmer company to write a review for this nail trimmer. I expect most of the glowing reviews on here are from customers who also were offered money. This trimmer is very slow and unhelpful. My 55 pound dog hates to have her paws touched. I thought this would make nail trims easier. It makes the process more dragged out and miserable for us both. I hate it. So much nail dust spreads around the room. I have to hold her nail against the grinder and she hates it. I’m worried about her fur getting caught in the mechanism. I hate this thing.
customer_reviews.author: francophile

customer_reviews.title: It’s just so simple...Charge and go!
customer_reviews.text: I had been using a pedipaws which was too large and heavy for my arthritic hands. I have 7 dogs and nail day was not fun! I LOVE this device! No batteries and rechargeable like my phone! It’s very compact. The dew claws are so much easier to grind! I cannot say enough about this product! It grinds those nails down in record time compared to my last nail grinder. Very pleased and with 7 dogs to trim, I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: MissyBelle

customer_reviews.title: It was good at first.
customer_reviews.text: It was good at first. My third time using it I noticed it wasn't keeping a charge. When I go to plug it in I noticed it wasn't keeping a charge. When I go to plug it in it doesn't blink the blue charging button anymore. My dogs nails are long as heck now, and it just went past the return date of a couple moths. Kinda sucks my dog needs her nails cut.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Cook

customer_reviews.title: Grinder Doesn't Stay Sharp
customer_reviews.text: I just got this over the weekend and have 2 akitas. It worked well for the first akita and didn't take much time to finish her nails down to a suitable length. Once I moved over to the male, I could tell that the grinder was already dulling. It took much longer and I still wasn't able to effectively get his nails to the shorter length that I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Mkode

customer_reviews.title: 👎🏻
customer_reviews.text: Battery died and won’t take a charge after three uses.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Strawn

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Happy with Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Our dogs, one is nearly 15 years old and the other is 11 and blind. I could never clip their nails myself as they hate so much. Only option was to bring them to Vet. I was skeptical with this devise but gave it a chance to try to save $$. It's very quite, hardly hear any noise. The grinder won't get overheated after the continuous use. Very gentle and super easy to use. Both of my dogs didn't careless while I was working on their nails. They both were so relaxed and ended up falling asleep snoring. Thank you for making the nail trimming without stress for me and the dogs!
customer_reviews.author: MS

customer_reviews.title: Dog clipper
customer_reviews.text: I just don’t care for it and I don’t like that it doesn’t come with charger.
customer_reviews.author: shirley boyle

customer_reviews.title: Small and easy to hold
customer_reviews.text: I have dachshunds with monster nails. my older grinder stopped working so I just received this today and trimmed 2 of my dogs and I am empressed with this, it worked fast and with the different angles it was easier to get to the nails while they sat down. I gave it 4 stars because I don't know how this will hold up but it seems to be a sturdy well built item.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than a dremel
customer_reviews.text: We used to use a dremel and this product is much easier to use. 1st off it’s cordless which is very convenient and the wheel grinds better than the sandpaper lined dremel tips. The durability seems great and is very easy to hold and maneuver. I would highly recommend this for smoothing down your dog’s nails.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This only works for teensy dogs.
customer_reviews.text: This thing was made for chinchilla paws. I have a Saint Bernard and now I am stuck with this product that only really works on her dew claws. Big waste of money. Do not buy for large or giant breed dogs.
customer_reviews.author: E. Lostaunau

customer_reviews.title: Takes too long.
customer_reviews.text: This did not work for my dog’s nails. I was really hopeful for this product. Unfortunately, it took WAY too long. Maybe 2 minutes a nail. Which is a really long time for my dog to be patient. I had a Dremel from Home Depot that worked way better. I gave it 3 stars because it is quiet and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Kacie

customer_reviews.title: Too loud
customer_reviews.text: This is loud and has a lot of vibration. We could not get the dogs to hold still for it. I'm returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Don’t use on your pets!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a few months ago. I wanted to wait to write the review. I wanted to give this product a fair chance. I have a 4 pound yorkie and a 90 pound lab. I tried using this on both my dogs . They did not like it. I started off slow, just letting them smell the grinders and get use to it. The grinder wheel gets hot after 1-2 seconds and make my pups cry out in pain. I do not recommend this product. It is also noisy and uneasy to use . Total waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Weak, Slow Grinder
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work as expected. It's very quiet, but the grinding wheel doesn't have enough grit to actually do the job. It's a polisher, NOT a trimmer. After several minutes of using it according to the directions (only a few seconds at a time, then pause a bit), we gave up. It was so slow that would've taken all night.
customer_reviews.author: Chris & Julie

customer_reviews.title: Does A Good Job
customer_reviews.text: This works well, but I would recommend it being used after having this done at the vet or groomer. It will be easy for maintenance, but will take forever to do it entirely. My dog does not have the patience. Either do I. :)
customer_reviews.author: Just My Thoughts

customer_reviews.title: You know what I hate?
customer_reviews.text: When I read a thousand stellar reviews and think this must be the best thing since sliced bread, then you buy the product and sure enough it's exactly what you though it would be. Mediocre at best and you're left wondering why you're the only one that doesn't love the product...But then wait for it, the mail came today and I got a letter from the company offering me a $10 Amazon gift card in exchange for a review of there product. Now it all makes sense. This should be not be allowed and had I known this was how they generated their reviews I'd have not bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Ian C

customer_reviews.title: Scary moment
customer_reviews.text: I think this might be for a bigger dog. I have a pig he’s very small and the lowest setting was way too fast and pulled his nail in between The file and the plastic protector I had to turn it off and try to free his nail. He is traumatized. The lowest setting needs to be a lot lower
customer_reviews.author: A. Towns

customer_reviews.title: Underpowered
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this grinder when I first got it for my two shepherds. It was fairly quiet, so the dogs didn’t get spooked. I’ve never been able to trim my dogs’ nails until I got this. I’ve had it six months and initially could do both dogs. Now I can only do one dog before recharging. The grinding stone could be a little larger and a little more power would help. This is probably great for smaller dogs, but strains with my shepherds. Update: Eight months after purchase, the power has really decreased, even at full charge. I can’t hold hold it on the nail without the stone stopping. Pretty worthless to me at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Kaispaw

customer_reviews.title: a bit narrow for my large golden retriever
customer_reviews.text: I can use it on him, but it's a bit of a struggle because of how narrow even the biggest side opening is. The top is wider but it doesn't seem to have the right angle or feel as stable. I can't go as short as I'd like using the side openings because his nails get wider further down and they don't fit in the space. I wouldn't have bought it for a dog this size if I'd known, but it does work and I will keep it. He usually hates the dremel and, in it's favor, I will say he doesn't object as much to this. Probably because it's quieter and quite stable.
customer_reviews.author: DeeVoe

customer_reviews.title: my dog ran away from this terrified!
customer_reviews.text: I followed the instructions. I fed her treats while it was on near her to get her used to it. But as soon as I touched it to her toe nail she squirmed like crazy and then ran away from me with her tail tucked between her legs. She hid from me in her crate and acted like I was a monster. I'm going to try an old fashioned nail clipper and see if that works better.
customer_reviews.author: BioBabe

customer_reviews.title: Takes forever to grind the nail down.
customer_reviews.text: The product works fine. I thought it’d grind the nails down a little faster. You have to hold it on the dogs nail for a VERY long time, which most dogs won’t sit for. I think the intent might be to clip the nail with clippers first and then use the grinder to get the nails as short as possible? Just not what I was expecting. It also creates a bad smell from the mail grinding, but that’s to be expected I suppose.
customer_reviews.author: Avalon

customer_reviews.title: Get this!!!
customer_reviews.text: I used this on my Chi for the first time today and loved it. She’s always so traumatized by the grooming visits, this will be a lifesaver. We did like suggested and gave her a small treat each time we used it. That pup loves her turkey. She never tried to jerk away so I felt reassured that it was uncomfortable for her.
customer_reviews.author: amy blevins

customer_reviews.title: Broke in first month
customer_reviews.text: Broke within the first month of using it. Just won’t turn on. Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Gymdragon

customer_reviews.title: Takes too long.
customer_reviews.text: Heavens to Betsy does it take forever to complete all the nails on my poor dog! It took an hour to file down all of her nails, by the time I was finished I was hot, sweaty, and downright angry! My dog was not pleased either. I figured there would be more power or force to get the job done faster. Should have just bought the clippers and snapped them off in a jiffy. Straight into the trash it went.
customer_reviews.author: Giovanni

customer_reviews.title: Large toenails take days to file down
customer_reviews.text: I have two large dogs with big nails. I filed on them for a several days, as long as each dog would tolerate (a couple of minutes) and I could not get the nails short enough or smooth like a Dremel. I had a groomer do it previously and it took her less than a minuted to file each dog. I think the idea of the Diamond file is good, but not enough "diamond" on the tool to really get a good smooth fast trim. The nails had a splintery look to them and still need more trimming. For those reasons I am returning it.
customer_reviews.author: S. CharmianTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Casfuy Dog Nail Grinder Upgraded - Professional 2-Speed - WAY TOO BIG FOR SMALL DOGS
customer_reviews.text: WAY TOO BIG FOR SMALL DOGS. THESE MAY BE OK FOR VERY LARGE DOGS BUT USELESS FOR SMALL DOGS. MY DOG IS 8 POUNDS AND THERE IS NO WAY TO USE THESE LARGE GRINDERS FOR A SMALL DOG.
customer_reviews.author: Garry Morrow

customer_reviews.title: Not so great for my pup
customer_reviews.text: The SECOND I turn it on, she flips out! I agree it's not super loud, but something about the sound must just bug her. Can't get it near her nails. I'll keep trying & will update the review if it goes better in the future, but for now it just doesn't work for me. If your dog is super calm or not sensitive to sound (or better yet old or deaf) it'd probably be great b/c the cost was decent and seems like it would work. Fingers crossed for better results.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer B

customer_reviews.title: Noisy and heavy vibrations
customer_reviews.text: It's noisier and vibrates pretty hard so we haven't been able to really use it yet as our pup is afraid of the noise. We've been turning it on and giving him treats to try to get him used to it, but after 10 or so days, he still won't let us use it on his nails. It does have 2 settings/speeds, but both are pretty noisy/loud. Battery life has held up (haven't had to recharge yet even after daily "use" Overall, if your pup is used to having his nails done, this seems nice. If your pup isn't used to nail trims, find something quieter to start out with.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: SAVE YOURSELF... BUY IT!!!! Won’t be disappointed!!
customer_reviews.text: COULD NOT BE HAPPIER WITH THIS!!! We got it for our two dogs (about 70&75 lbs) I thought maybe there nails would be to big as what I read on another review but there was plenty of room if needed!!! I love it has two speeds!! I put it on high and speed through their nails.. I got it today and used it right from the box.. then put it on the charger!! One dog didn’t care the other dog I had to work with a little bit more. This was their first experience with an electric file.. honestly.. this price.. so easy to use and gave great results!! Very happy. Highly suggest if you need one!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nail grinder for dogs
customer_reviews.text: Best 22.95 I have ever spent !! Just tried it on my bulldogs nails her nails were extra long ! Low noise and had the front two paws done quickly
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Bush

customer_reviews.title: Game changer for trimming my large dog's nails
customer_reviews.text: I have a larger dog (70 lbs) and she has all black nails. I have always been scared to cut them with clippers since I have hit the quick a couple of times. On top of that, she is pretty restless when I am trimming them. For my dog, I actually took the guard all the way off and use it. She doesn't mind it at all. I usually only do like 3 - 5 seconds per nail and she doesn't get annoyed by it. In addition to being easy to use, it leaves the nails super smooth instead of all jagged. I would recommend this to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy W

customer_reviews.title: Holly cow! I could trim hooves with this bad boy!
customer_reviews.text: For $22 bucks I was half expecting to have a little easy bake oven quality nail grinder. Nope! This this was so powerful! And straight from the box. I didn’t even need to charge it. I had been procrastinating on getting my dog groomed so her nails were crazy long. She’s a mut of some type, guessing pit/lab/pug. And she’s also the Best Dog in the World so she just laid there for about 20mins and let me practice on getting it right. I was so impressed and absolutely covered in nail dust but more so impressed! I would just recommend maybe having a vacuum handy if you’re doing it inside.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly K.

customer_reviews.title: Doggone Good!
customer_reviews.text: This replaced a Dremel w/small sanding drum. It's astonishingly better. No, not just a little, but a whole lot! This thing is much quieter, subjects the claw to almost no vibration, cuts cleanly and in a controller manner. It's also lighter and easier to control than the Dremel, and the guard holds the claw from moving off to the side, allowing you to swing the handle gently back and forth to "round" the ends of the claw so there's no abrupt edges to catch or split. Very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: bumper

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for an alternative to taking my pup for a nail grind every 2 weeks. After watching a quick YouTube video from a couple of professionals, I decided to give it a try. I have now ground his black nails twice and it has gone amazingly well. The first key is to trim back any hairs sticking out because they’ll get caught and cause pain. I have a poodle mix who weighs approximately 12 pounds. The noise didn’t bother my 3 year old at all. I had plenty of treats on hand and gave lots of praise. It’s already paid for itself!
customer_reviews.author: LaEvening2012

customer_reviews.title: low quality
customer_reviews.text: Not as promised. The battery doesn't hold enough juice for large 4 leggers. It's noisier than other models I tried, and also generate more vibration in hand as well, so if your dog is more sensitive to noise like mine look for something quieter. No spare grinding disks and grinding slots on the stone shield are very small to accommodate larger paws. It's more expensive than other models I saw on amazon so I was hoping for a better product that compensates for the higher price!!
customer_reviews.author: Horse Rider

customer_reviews.title: It does the job
customer_reviews.text: I like this and it does the job, but the dust from grinding flies everywhere and I inhale it the whole time I’m using it which means my dog does too so I am not happy about that, I wish it had a built in dust catcher or something that helps iliminate the cloud of nail dust that you inhale the whole time you use it. The noise level is fairly low and it’s easy to use. (If you register for a warranty you’ll notice that the website has some major grammatical issues with improper spelling and verb usage so I found that very odd for a “professional business”). In all, you get what you pay for with this product.
customer_reviews.author: B. Slate

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping this would be more powerful than the last grinder I purchased. It’s just ok. The grinder itself loses power quickly even after being fully charged. It is quiet but rather thick in the hand and not quite comfortable. The last pet grinder I purchased was slimmer and broke after only a few uses, it was less expensive. The grinder itself unattached from the base. So I chose to pay more for this one which had good reviews and was labeled “professional “. I’m hopeful this one will hold up longer
customer_reviews.author: Nancilou Biscotti

customer_reviews.title: Unsafe for small dogs!
customer_reviews.text: Product is well built and low noise, however it is NOT safe for small dogs. I have a toy poodle and read the instructions carefully. I used the smallest port and used caution. However, my dogs nail was swept under the guard and caught in the grinder. She yelped loudly and it hurt her paw! Thankfully the damage was cosmetic only to her nail and she recovered within a few minutes but I will never use this machine again. It would have been safer to NOT use the guard port.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie T

customer_reviews.title: Pretty quiet, VERY effective
customer_reviews.text: I literally have to wrestle both of my dogs normally to cut their nails (40 and 50 lbs). I thought this was probably going to be another no-go but figured I had nothing to lose and tried it. I was so pleasantly surprised that after a little time getting used to it they were both pretty accepting. They’ll only tolerate it for so long (which isn’t really a problem because on the higher setting it grinds through pretty quickly) and I think you still have to watch for the quick but they aren’t terrified of the grinder they way they are of the claw clippers. I definitely recommend this to anyone with stubborn-footed dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa G.

customer_reviews.title: Quality Build
customer_reviews.text: Build feels durable. Diamond wheel is sharp. Motor is quiet so your pet isnt afraid of this. Ive used the "As Seen On TV" dog nail grinder and its not as powerful as this. No batteries to change out or worry about it dying out right in the middle of grinding your pets nails. I would recommend to plug in the charger as soon as youre done to avoid it from dying the next time you need to use this. Highly recommended this product.
customer_reviews.author: H.P

customer_reviews.title: Vibration might be issue for your pet
customer_reviews.text: My animals are nervous but ok with the noise level. However, the vibration they do not like at all. I bought to keep from using regular clippers. My animals will not let me use this device, unless I restrain them. It does work well, if you are able to get your cat or dog to agree with the proceedure. Nicely built, sturdy, has safety guards, but a bit higher priced then a couple other website I found. 4 is because I can not use it on my animals :( So totally defeats the purpose for buying.
customer_reviews.author: Tamara

customer_reviews.title: Motor Dying After 6 Months
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend this product based on the motor being burnt out. I trim two pitbulls once a month and I can no longer use this product to file/buff because the motor stops providing force after a small amount of resistance from the nail is given. Guess I'll just stick with files for now.
customer_reviews.author: J. Banks

customer_reviews.title: Borrowed and Bought
customer_reviews.text: Yesterday my sister needed help trimming her foster dog's nails. I brought my nail clippers ad cut off as much as I could without hitting the quicks. The nails were still quite long so my sister brought out her nail grinder (this one here). I used it for the first time yesterday and I ordered in 5 minutes later. My past experience with a nail grinder wasn't great - it was big and large. This trimmer is smaller and quieter, which is perfect! It's not as scary for the dogs (most still don't like it when the grinder actually touches their nails but that's unavoidable). I trim nails professionally and I'm happy I've added this piece to my collection!
customer_reviews.author: LilyoftheThorns

customer_reviews.title: Dog Nail Grinder Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new nail grinder since my old one died after years of use. I decided to try another brand and Casfuy is a nice replacement! The best thing I like so far is the fact my dog didn't run away after I did her nails! It was very quiet compared to the other one. I prefer to take the shield off so I have full access to the grinder wheel when doing my dog's nails. Easy to hold, easy to use and the plug in charger is great!
customer_reviews.author: Creekvue

customer_reviews.title: Very gentle
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to trim my dog’s nails, since groomer has been closed during the pandemic. I would tuen it on every few days to try to bet him used to the sound, but it scared him, even though it really is pretty quiet. Finally, I put some peanut butter on a plate and got the job done while he ate the peanut butter. This is a much better option than nail clippers, as I always have problems with that. I was so happy I was finally able to trim his nails. I may be doing it all the time, instead of spending money at the groomer’s. This is a great product!!
customer_reviews.author: Salee

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I was shocked and awed by this inexpensive little grinder. It's lightweight, quiet, and extremely efficient. My dogs hate getting their nails done. The design is easy to use and the nail fits easily in the opening for grinding and can be gently rotated for smoothing/shaping. The grinder works quickly, but the nails were relatively smooth after and didn't need to be sanded down. I've only used it once, so I can't attest to its long-term durability and it does take quite some time to charge fully, but I don't need it very often, so it isn't a problem. I didn't notice any drain on the power through two dogs worth of nail grinding (and their nails were quite long).
customer_reviews.author: April McGehee Azbill

customer_reviews.title: My Gentle Giant (and Tiny Nervous Yorkie) Both Now Let Me Take Care of Their Nails!
customer_reviews.text: I have a Husky/Boxer mix who is VERY skittish and a Yorkie who HATES having her nails clipped! I didn't have high hopes that I could grind their nails at home, but thought that it was worth the cost as our groomer wasn't allowing drop in nail appts during the quarantine. I was pleasantly surprised by how quiet and easy this was to use - both allowed me to grind their nails after easing them into the sound, smell and feel of the grinder!! LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.author: S. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, safe and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty quiet great little nail grinder. I have never used one before and only used the metal manual clippers. I initially turned it on next to my golden retriever puppy. Then let it vibrate against her foot. Then ground her nails. She doesn't love it but she doesn't fuss much. I feel so much more confident using this than the metal manual nail clippers. They used to scare me that I would cut too much. I would definitely recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Pinky fun

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price!
customer_reviews.text: We have two dogs who don't really enjoy getting their nails trimmed. I was going to send them to get their nails done at the pet store, but the cost of 2 'manicures' would end up just about equalling the cost of owning the grinder. this grinder is very quiet and did not startle the dogs. It took a long time to get the dogs comfortable with the grinder, but the instructions for introduction that came with the product were very clear and helpful. The dogs don't love the grinder, but they enjoy it much better compared to traditional clippers. I am also more comfortable using it because of the safety guards and it is much gentler for the dogs.
customer_reviews.author: MacDonald

customer_reviews.title: Good product. Naughty dog! Too bad puppy!!
customer_reviews.text: Pandemic has curtailed grooming visits😩 My little guy loves to play but when his nails get too long my arms become a battle scarred mess! (Sun damaged skin paper thin). He hates anyone messing with the paws, so still good natured, but impossible wiggler. I used the low speed to “get him used to it” but next time I’ll just get after it. Takes two anyway! He’s not afraid, he just doesn’t like you messing with his paws! Too bad, so sad! Good product! Like the slot to put the nail in. Not loud. Decent price! Recharge!! In his defense, he is otherwise very easy. I can do anything else I need to do, but don’t touch my 🐾!
customer_reviews.author: Kate  Smith

customer_reviews.title: Best Nail Trimmer Available on Market
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for my old nail trimmer that uses sandpaper that needs to be replaced often. It was noisy unlike this one which is almost completely silent. It is light weight and easy to handle. I love the option to not use batteries which never lasted anyway. My old trimmer was a plug in type. This one allows me to easily charge and use it almost anywhere. I appreciate the life time warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Missallycat

customer_reviews.title: Keep looking
customer_reviews.text: Still freaks dogs out. Not much better than a dremel (sp?)
customer_reviews.author: KHO

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic! Never Going Back to Nail Clippers!!
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing! If you are thinking about escaping from the dog toe nail clipper routine... take the plunge. I am so ticked at myself for not trying this earlier. The key is that it works quickly, but not too quickly and you can shorten and sort of sculpt the toe nail... Dog is more relaxed to boot. And no more split toe nails, or cuts into the quick. And yes, I introduced it with a treat... did just one toe the first time... then the next day all the rest, so my dog could get used to the feeling (the sound is hardly noticeable.) Go for it! Enjoy nail clipping again (well, almost-smile)
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC FOR LEFT HANDED PEOPLE!
customer_reviews.text: This was my first time grinding a dog’s nails. There was a bit of a learning curve but I became comfortable after a few minutes. The unit was very quiet and whatever little noise it made didn’t bother my dog. It was very comfortable to hold and use. Being left handed, I was concerned about using the grinder but had no problem at all. I started out on the high speed to take length and switched to the low speed for filing smooth. I am very happy with the product and the investment is worth it’s weight in gold since grooming expenses have gotten out of hand lately.
customer_reviews.author: Joan Petrone

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This works better than grinders I’ve bought in the past. It’s great that it’s chargeable too so I don’t have to deal with a cord. My dog’s hate getting their nails cut. The grinder wasn’t necessarily any better, per se. But it certainly wasn’t worse! What’s great with a grinder is that you can get the nails a bit shorter than cutting and the nails are left soft and rounded rather than sharp and scratchy. My dog can jump up on me now without it hurting! Also, my husband has a weird toenail that is hard and ugly and greenish, but I can use this grinder to grind down the top layer of his nail to make it semi-normal looking!
customer_reviews.author: shalomvendetta

customer_reviews.title: Effective and Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: This is my second nail grinder for my dog, and it is superior to my previous model that was made by a company that is well-known for grinding tools. The shroud around the spinning stone makes it much easier to avoid accidents. I also like the included cap that protects the grinder from damage when stored. I have found the grinder easy to apply to my dog's nails. The noise level is acceptable and relatively quiet. Remember to be sure to let your dog get used to the sound of the grinder before actually using it on him. We gave our dog treats when we were acclimating him to the sound so that he would associate nail-trimming time with treats.
customer_reviews.author: John Canales

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: One of my dogs completely flips out when his nails have to be cut. He'll pretty much break his own arm trying to get away. I bought this hoping I could get his nail length down with less trouble, and I'm pretty happy with it. He still freaks out a little bit because he doesn't like his paws touched, but I can get him relaxed enough that I can get through all of his paws in one session by myself. I like all the different slots available on the grinder. It acts as a holder to keep his nails in place but also gives you options for different angles to come in from. Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: MechaStreisand

customer_reviews.title: everyone needs this!
customer_reviews.text: This nail grinder is amazing! It works very well and even my dog that hates his nails done is OK with this nail grinder. It is quiet, has 2 sizes which is perfect because I can do my puppy and also my great Pyrenees with ease. It charges by USB so you don't have to run out of batteries and be unable to use it until you find more. I absolutely love this for all our nail grooming needs!
customer_reviews.author: Shay VR

customer_reviews.title: Does what is says, is what it does
customer_reviews.text: We take our dog to the Groomers about every 6 weeks and because he's an excited jumper we are always getting scratched inbetween grooming appointments. After looking on amazon, this casfuy nail grinder seemed to have good reviews and was at the right price point 20. Followed the directions, let our dog inspect it and get accustomed to the noise, which is similar to a small electric razor. After grinding down each paw I gave him a treat, and told him he was a good boy. I'm sure with all things he'll get more comfortable and we'll get better at doing it. Just hope I don't run out of treats.
customer_reviews.author: Jason L.

customer_reviews.title: Recommend wearing a mask
customer_reviews.text: I have a few dogs of different breeds and sizes and every single one hated it. They were terrified of the noise and especially the actual grinding of the nails. I also didn’t like how the nail dust gets everywhere. Especially if you have a bigger dog with thicker nails, there’s no way to control the nail dust so it just flies at your face and you end up breathing it in.
customer_reviews.author: brandi solis

customer_reviews.title: Dog nails? No problem
customer_reviews.text: My dogs have nails that grow really quickly it seems, and holding them to clip them with the doggy nail clippers was hard. This? I can get some peanut butter on a spoon and they will lick that while I trim their nails. The sound still startles them, so make sure you get them acclimated to the sound of it/the smell. I normally turn mine on for a minute or so before i actually use it, so they know the sound and don't get as scared. It's definitely helpful, especially since one of my dogs is a big boy and holding him down to clip nails is ROUGH. This is definitely worth it, and it's very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: HighHarley

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected for my cats!
customer_reviews.text: I actually used this nail grinder on my cats claws. I was absolutely dreading the task of trimming my two cat's nails. Bringing the cats to the vet for grooming is expensive, a huge undertaking (as any cat owner can attest to), and with the pandemic, appointments are harder to get. I must say that I am completely satisfied with this nail grinder. The noise level is very low, no noticeable vibrations, easy to hold, not too big for a cat's finer (and sharper!) nails, and the grinder bit was perfect in size and adjustable power. Using this tool made a difficult task easier.
customer_reviews.author: JCM2001

customer_reviews.title: Best nail grinder that I have found
customer_reviews.text: I have several nail grinders of similar styles and prices as the Casfuy. I also have several that have cost $100 dollars or more. We have 6 Cardigan Corgis and I need something that will be fast, efficient and not be very loud. The Casfuy is without a doubt the best nail grinder that I now own. It does a great, fast job, is very easy to hold and is the quietest of all the grinders. None of the dogs are bothered by it whereas, they are very bothered by some of the others. I will be selling the rest of my nail grinders on ebay or to other dog folk. Thank you Casfuy for such a superior product.
customer_reviews.author: CAFA

customer_reviews.title: STOP ---> Just Buy It!
customer_reviews.text: No joke, stop reading this and go click "Buy Now". My dog hates getting his nails clipped (long quips) and I can't stand doing it. The poor guy has to wait 1-2mo for his grooming appointment at PetSmart, where I get gouged 15 bucks for them to EXACTLY what this product does!!! I feel like such an idiot, I wish I found this years ago. It has not only saved me money, but improved my dogs quality of life. PRO TIP: The first time you use it treat your dog after letting him smell it, again after turning it on & off, and after grinding every nail while praising generously. My dog almost sleeps during nail grindings now LOL!
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Best grinder yet
customer_reviews.text: I bought this when I was unable to take my senior dog to the vet for her nail trims this past spring. I have used it in combination with the traditional trimmer as needed but she has adjusted well to it. Make sure to take time getting your dog used to the sound (which is not loud) well before you start actually touching their nails with it. Use treats as positive reinforcement. It's portable so I can take it along when we go outside to sit in the yard as well. This little machine has been a lifesaver for me and others in my family as well who couldn't get their dogs in to the groomer these past months. Recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Daisy

customer_reviews.title: 3 months later.....  Easy to handle
customer_reviews.text: After years of using a small, name brand rotary grinder, my wife decided to try a dedicated nail grinder. This tool is quiet, and easy to handle. Our Yorkies have hairy feet, and the old grinder with the open barrel sander was always a danger to catching their hair and sucking the machine up against their toes. The grinding surface on this is never going to work out, but cuts smoothly. Great tool. PS 3 month update: Still working from initial charge. This thing is incredible! My Yorkies hated the Drimmel.... and don’t mind This at all. Much quieter. No fur caught around the barrel. I am a happy camper.
customer_reviews.author: Vago&Cat

customer_reviews.title: Works so well on black nails
customer_reviews.text: My little Jack Russell has black nails and I hate trimming them for fear of hurting her as I cannot see the quick. This tool makes it SO easy and painless to trim/file her nails. We allowed her to be near it while running. Showed it to her. We did that for a couple of days and just left it sitting out on the dog treat cabinet. Today, we were able to successfully trim her nails whilst giving her tiny pieces of her favorite treat after each nail. Anyone who has a Jack knows how persnickety they can be. This is a huge win in our books! Thank you for a great product!
customer_reviews.author: C. L.

customer_reviews.title: So much better than clipping
customer_reviews.text: We have a very energetic dog and clipping nails has always been a scary job for us. We don't want to hurt him, so using a grinder to smooth the nails down seemed like an obvious choice. What wasn't obvious was figuring out which grinder to get. Luckily, the Casfuy nail grinder seems to have all of the features that we wanted! Multiple nail slots for different sized dogs, a diamong grinder, rechargeable with a USB cable (yay for no battery waste!). The grinder has a slight amount of heft to it, which makes it feel sturdy (like you're not going to lose your grip on it). The instructions are simple and it's easy to use. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Hutchind

customer_reviews.title: A life-saver - for us!
customer_reviews.text: During this time of covid, it was impossible to take our very sweet elderly dog to a groomer - and our sweet girl completely detests nail clippers. However, her long nails were driving us crazy on our hard wood floors. So, with real hesitation I brought this nail grinder as a last resort. And it worked beautifully. I spent a week getting her used to it...the sound, what it might feel like etc. I still needed spouse's help when it came time to do her nails, but she was much less reactive that either of us anticipated. The grinder did the job. Her nails went from sharp nails to a soft patter on our floors. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: BriaBoston

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny. Works well on harder black dog nails.
customer_reviews.text: I bought another dog nail grinder that was slightly cheaper in March when Covid shut down the groomers in my area. Even though it had good reviews, it didn't work well for me. Then, in June, I bought this one at the recommendation of a friend. For only five bucks more it makes a HUGE difference. I can get through all of the nails on both my dogs in 20 minutes and the battery lasts the whole time. It's a little bit louder than the cheaper one, but still not very loud. My dogs are used to having their nails done with a grinder, and little bits of bacon get them through it without too much struggle.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny H.

customer_reviews.title: Great product and works well.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to hold, easy to use. My black pitbull is a freak about getting her nails trimmed. The vet's office has traumatized her after her last 2 cuttings, that I'm attempting to do it at home with someone helping me. Following the advice and easing her into the grinder before actually using it on her definitely helped. I'm able to get some toe nails ground down in one sitting as long as someone is holding her with me. She's already way more comfortable with the grinder than with the clipper. Don't get me wrong. She's still a freak, but at least I'm getting somewhere with the grinder!
customer_reviews.author: C. H.

customer_reviews.title: Quiet!  Works Well But Had To Remove Cowling
customer_reviews.text: This is indeed very quiet. But I've been using a Dremel, which is noisy but which allows me to really grind down the claws and see what I am doing. I still have to use it for one dog, but the two other (10 lbs and 13 lbs) dogs can use this one. Still, the opening for the claws was too small, so I asked my husband and he removed the cowling. It's quick and quiet. I also noticed in some instruction thing that you're supposed to clip the claws first, but I grind instead of clipping, so that didn't help. Good instrument, good company, just did fit my needs until I altered it. Now It Does.
customer_reviews.author: Kirsten A. Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: No More Clippers
customer_reviews.text: We have a dog with dewclaws that must be trimmed about every two weeks. For years we used clippers, but the dog hated the 'clipper event' where my wife and I would team up on the poor dog. We finally bought this grinder after thorough research and asking several dog owners for a demonstration of their grinders. This grinder was our choice and it has been as good as advertised. We give the dog a small treat before the nail grinding, a treat between paws, and a treat at the end. She now looks forward to the events. We still team up on her, but it is so much easier than the clipper.
customer_reviews.author: J. Vincent Eccles

customer_reviews.title: Not good for thick nails on large breeds!!
customer_reviews.text: It worked well for my sister's chiweenie, but I have a 120 pound dog with very thick and long nails and it didn't work well for his at all. Kinda disappointed that no dog dremmels work for large breeds with thick nails. I ended up need to get a hardware store dremmel.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis coffman

customer_reviews.title: Best dog nail grinder we have found
customer_reviews.text: The noise level seems acceptable to my four dogs. This grinder actually works -- unlike some I have had in the past. It's a little on the heavy side, but not so much that it impairs its usefulness. Rechargeable is definitely a preferred feature, since getting tangled up in the cord is annoying to both groomer and groomee. It is also good to have the two speeds and ports for large and small dogs'. Customer service has been excellent, with communication started the same day we received the item. Instructions were very clear. We especially liked the free ebook!
customer_reviews.author: JudithTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little skeptical about buying this product. I had wanted to get the Dremel brand nail grinder but it was on back order. After reading all the positive reviews I ended up purchasing this one and am so glad I did! Not only was it a much better price, it works great! I slowly introduced my dog to the sound with some treats, but he didn’t seem bothered by the noise. I’ve been doing just a little at a time every few days and things are going well. He doesn’t love having nails worked on but he seem much more relaxed with this method. He absolutely HATES getting his nail trimmed!
customer_reviews.author: JMB

customer_reviews.title: Very quiet.  Exceeds expectations.
customer_reviews.text: The noise level of this trimmer was way below that of what I expected and works exceptionally well. Although my dog was a bit skiddish at first, he is starting to warm up to it (treat induced). He is much more accepting of this than the traditional clippers. The only minor complaint is that the slot for the larger nails is not large enough for my 100 lb dog (I can easily modify to work). All in all, I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Howard

customer_reviews.title: It sucks. It isn't abrasive/aggressive enough.
customer_reviews.text: Takes way too long to shorten the nail and no dog wants to sit still that long for each nail. Nail dust flying around is not a good feature. Should be some kind of suction that takes advantage of the spinning, and draws dust IN.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey W DeBaker

customer_reviews.title: I Just Got My Casfuy Nail Grinder ...
customer_reviews.text: ... and haven't had a chance to use it yet. But based on the fast delivery, how quiet it runs (we'll find out about grinding when I learn how to use it) and the comfortable way it fits in my hand, I thought it rated at least 3 stars. A happy surprise is the well-written instructions that are easy to follow. That's worth another 2 stars. I had thought of using my son's dremmel, but just turning it on was ear-splitting. Nope, wasn't going to torture my dog with that thing. If something should change my opinion of the product, I'll edit my review. But I really don't expect that to happen.
customer_reviews.author: Purplechuckwagon

customer_reviews.title: amazing product
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. I have a basset hound mix who has badly deformed paws that continue to get worse as she ages. I have 2 of the standard nail clippers for dogs. I absolutely hate cutting them with a nail clipper because I’m not confident and my pup can tell therefore it makes her nervous. Her quick has grown entirely too long and I felt like I couldn’t clip them confidently. So my friend recommended a grinder - this one had great reviews..so I bought it! I’m so so happy that I did! It is gentle, quiet and helps slowly get her quick smaller. I’m much more confident in doing so too :) very very happy!!!
customer_reviews.author: Karina Nilson

customer_reviews.title: First Time My Dog Let Me Clip Her Nails
customer_reviews.text: My dog is high anxiety and extremely skittish. She always makes it nearly impossible to cut her nails, which is why we always bring her to the groomer. Well with quarantine were not able to and her nails were desperately needing to be cut. This is quite for a grinder and allows you to have full control of how much you want to cut so you don't risk hurting your fur baby.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander 702

customer_reviews.title: Made My Life Easier!
customer_reviews.text: I have two senior dogs that hate having their nails done, and a new puppy. This grinder is so quiet my older female doesn't even try to pull her paw away anymore. My older male suffers from arthritis and this makes it so much faster to get his nails shortened so he has an easier time getting his footing. The puppy is not afraid of the noise, but her nails are still so short I'm afraid I will catch hair while using the product. But I feel certain she will do great with it.
customer_reviews.author: Leah Randall

customer_reviews.title: Wish I knew about the quiet grinder years ago!
customer_reviews.text: I have a dog that hates having her nails trimmed. It's been a challenge for six years. I was skeptical about getting a grinder but decided to take the chance. I used it as soon as it showed up. I couldn't believe it! She just laid there while I grinded her nails! Usually, I'm having to chase and hold her down as she tries yanking her paws from me the whole time. In addition, she has black nails, which is a real challenge trying to cut the nails without hitting the quick. This method, I had not problems with bleeding. I wish I knew about this sooner!
customer_reviews.author: Chrizzee

customer_reviews.title: CASFUY Dog Nail Grinder
customer_reviews.text: I am just a beginner in using a nail grinder for my collie. I usually have her professionally groomed, but with the pandemic, have started grooming her myself. This dog nail grinder was easy to use/hold and is very powerful. I feel more comfortable using this grinder as my dog has black toenails and it is hard to see the quick. Now I can take off as much nail as I need slowly as opposed to a nail clipper that once you cut, there's no return. I have only used this product once, but am very happy with it so far. The company also provided an e-book on how to grind nails, which I found very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: JJL

customer_reviews.title: So quiet it's easy to leave on when you put it down!!
customer_reviews.text: My dogs are afraid of electric dog shears, so we have to clip their hair with scissors. So we were not confident that the Casfuy Dog Nail Grinder would be quiet enough to prevent our dogs from fleeing the scene. Good news, it is so quiet and smooth operating that, not only do our dogs not notice it, we have put it down and answered the phone only to come back and learn that we left it running because it really is that quiet. But being quiet certainly doesn't make it weak, as it grinds dog nails quickly and effortlessly. Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Roro22407

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! It worked for my nervous dog!
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to purchase this because my dog hates when I even touch his nails. He bites, and cries when he knows it's time to trim his nails. He was a little wary at first but settled right down once he realized it would not hurt him. I was pleasantly surprised that he didn't throw a fit with this. It is very quiet, to the point where my dog didn't notice it after a few seconds of it being on. This is my first time using a nail grinder, and it is so simple. The little guard around the grinder make it easy to grind the nail evenly. I will never go back to regular clippers. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: So far, it lives up to its hype
customer_reviews.text: Only used it twice to far and definitely like it. I think my fur baby will adapt easily to it. Way better then clipping and then filing, so nice to do it all in one. This filer definitely speeds up the nail grooming sessions for my puppers, life changing. This one’s even better than my own acrylic nail filer lol. Hopefully the battery lasts for a while between charges. I only charged it the one time after receiving it, used it twice so far without charging it in between. Hoping we don’t need to get a filer replacement head for a while either. I’ll see how it goes after having and using it for a while.
customer_reviews.author: S.Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient
customer_reviews.text: I much prefer this to the traditional dog nail trimmer! One can slowly shorten the nail which greatly reduces the risk of cutting the quick. I’m impressed with how quiet it is. You can approach the nail from several different angles which makes it easier to use than traditional trimmers. The result is a smooth nail without sharp edges. Now, if I could only get my dog to be more cooperative.
customer_reviews.author: MoSigler

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: This is such an amazing trimmer! My (nearly five year old) Rough Collie Mix has been a nightmare since day one with nail trimmings. He is a sensitive boy and he has never been able to handle them well, even professional groomers have difficulties with trimming his nails - until now! I ordered this to just "take the edge off" (quite literally) and he is doing fantastic! With some basic coaxing and a gentle restraint, I am able to use this on his nails with no fuss, and his nails are better than they have ever been! I am loving this trimmer, it is one of the best grooming products I have ever invested in!
customer_reviews.author: Kasey

product_meta.title: Casfuy Dog Nail Grinder Upgraded - Professional 2-Speed Electric Rechargeable Pet Nail Trimmer Painless Paws Grooming & Smoothing for Small Medium Large Dogs & Cats
feature_bullets: Safe, Effective & Precise Trimming: This dog nail grinder uses an advanced diamond drum bit grinder to deliver the safest, most comfortable pet claw grinding. Recommended by veterinarians and pet grooming professionals, painlessly and precisely trim your pet's nails anywhere.

Advanced 2-Speed Switch & 3 Grinding Ports: The trimmer features an adjustable, low-high speed design powerful enough support heavy grinding. And with 3 ports to match small, medium, or large pets, simply choose the appropriate port and speed depending on your pet's size and nail hardness.

Super Low Noise & Vibration: Many pets get stressed by the sound and vibration of pet nail grinder. However, our electric pet nail grinder uses a superior motor with whisper-quiet technology that produces a very low vibration to keep pets calm and help sand pets claws faster and easier.

Rechargeable & Portable: The cordless dog grinder is rechargeable and has an indicator light on the bottom that turns on when charging. Each grinder has a built-in battery that lasts 2 hours after a 3-hour charge. The lightweight and ergonomic body design also makes it easier to handle in your right or left hand.
